sense.name: liberties
sense.commentary: an abstract idea of that which is due a person or governmental body by law or tradition or nature (typically legal rights)
sense.examples: They are endowed by thier Creator with certain unalienable Rights. "Certain rights can never granted to the government but must be kept in the hands of the people." -Eleanor Roosevelt A right is not something that somebody give you it is something that nobody can take away. The author of my favorite book sold the film rights recently.

sense.name: a position beside
sense.commentary: location near or direction toward the right side; the side to the south when a person faces east
sense.examples: He stood on the right. Follow the road for 2.3 miles and my house will be on the right.

sense.name: a turn
sense.examples: Make a right at the corner of Broad and Market. Take right after you see the church.

sense.name: right wing
sense.commentary: those who support political or social or economic conservatism, those who believe that things are better left unchanged
sense.examples: I'm affiliated with the Right these days. The political right will be disappointed if their candidate doesn't win.

sense.name: fairness
sense.commentary: rightfulness - anything in accord with principles of justice
sense.examples: He feels he is in the right.

sense.name: your other left hand
sense.commentary: the hand that is on the right side of the body
sense.examples: He writes with his right hand but pitches with his left. Hit him with quick rights to the body.

sense.name: outfield
sense.commentary: the piece of ground in the outfield on the catcher's right
sense.examples: George always plays right. The player in right was looking around when the ball was flying at him.
